user_question: My Car windows are broken can i clame
expanded_query: A comprehensive search for a warranty document should focus on passages that indicate whether the damage to the vehicle's windows, including terms such as "breakage," "cracks," or "shattering," is covered under the car's warranty. Relevant sections may specify if this type of incident falls under "defects," "malfunctions," or "manufacturer's responsibility." The search should also consider passages where replacement or repair of broken windows, under the circumstances provided by the user, is deemed "coverable" or "claimable" under the terms and conditions of the warranty.

Warranty Coverage Details:
 
The following parts and systems are covered under the warranty:
 
 
Engine Assembly (cylinder block, pistons, crankshaft, camshaft)
 
 
Transmission System (automatic/manual gearbox, torque converter)
 
 
Cooling System (radiator , water pump, thermostat)
 
 
Fuel Injection System
 
 
Electrical System (ECU, alternator , starter motor)
 
 
Air Conditioning & Heating Unit
 
 
Suspension Components (shocks, struts, control arms)

final_answer: No, you cannot claim under this warranty as the coverage does not extend to car windows (The warranty document does not mention car windows). Confidence: Low
